headline: Ugandan rugby legend Robert Sseguya is dead
author: Ismail Dhakaba Kigongo
description: Soggy, as he was fondly known, lost the battle to leukemia on Tuesday.
articleBody:
By

Managing Editor (Sports)

Daily Monitor

What you need to know:

Won the Elgon Cup in 2006
African Champion in 2002 and 2007
Won the league with Heathens in 2002, 2004, 2009, 2010, 2011
Won the Uganda Cup with Heathens 2010, 2009, 2007, 2005, 2004, 2002, 2001
Played for Uganda in 7s at the Commonwealth Games in 2006 and 2010
Played for Uganda in the IRB Sevens circuit in 2001, 2003, 2004.

Babu Owino offers to buy DJ Evolve a house

MP Babu Owino will purchase an apartment for the victim, which will resolve the issue of house rent.

Africa backs Ethiopia protest against UN rights session

Session meant to reprimand Addis Ababa’s alleged war atrocities in Tigray region.

Africa 3 hours ago

By

Managing Editor (Sports)

Daily Monitor

  • Played for Uganda in 7s at the Commonwealth Games in 2006 and 2010
  • Played for Uganda in the IRB Sevens circuit in 2001, 2003, 2004.

headline: 'That's greatness!' Stephen Curry sets NBA three-point record
author: AFP
description: Curry's remarkable shooting range has revolutionised the NBA in his 13-year tenure.

headline: Kenya detects first Omicron cases among arriving travellers
author: Winnie Atieno
description: CS Kagwe saidys the government will not lockdown the country.

headline: NBA: After Curry's 3-point record, five other standout feats
author: AFP
description: NBA great Wilt Chamberlain scored an astounding 100 points in a single game on March 2, 1962.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

Jordan, still considered by many the greatest NBA player in history, retired in 2003 with an average of 30.1 points per game, the best in history.
Bill Russell, the legendary Boston Celtics center, owns more championship rings, 11, than he can wear on both hands.
Russell Westbrook broke another once apparently indestructible record in May, when he bested Oscar Robertson's record for career triple-doubles, which had stood since 1974.
Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, the legendary Bucks and Lakers star, accumulated a total of 38,387 points in a career spanning two decades, the most for any NBA player.
NBA great Wilt Chamberlain scored an astounding 100 points in a single game on March 2, 1962, when his Philadelphia Warriors beat the New York Knicks 169-147.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • Jordan, still considered by many the greatest NBA player in history, retired in 2003 with an average of 30.1 points per game, the best in history.
  • Bill Russell, the legendary Boston Celtics center, owns more championship rings, 11, than he can wear on both hands.
  • Russell Westbrook broke another once apparently indestructible record in May, when he bested Oscar Robertson's record for career triple-doubles, which had stood since 1974.
  • Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, the legendary Bucks and Lakers star, accumulated a total of 38,387 points in a career spanning two decades, the most for any NBA player.
  • NBA great Wilt Chamberlain scored an astounding 100 points in a single game on March 2, 1962, when his Philadelphia Warriors beat the New York Knicks 169-147.

headline: CS Amina to defend World Motor Sports Council seat
author: Peter Njenga
description: The council is the Federation Internationale de I’ Automobile’s (FIA) supreme organ.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

Any vote cast during the time allowed will be registered, and the system will issue a confirmation of the registration of the vote.
During the time allowed for voting on a given question, each member will be able to correct his or her vote in case of an error. The vote that is definitively registered by the system will be the last vote cast at the time of closure of the vote.

Sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohamed and Surinder Thatthi are expected to defend their seats during the World Motor Sports Council General Assembly in Paris, France on Friday.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • Any vote cast during the time allowed will be registered, and the system will issue a confirmation of the registration of the vote.
  • During the time allowed for voting on a given question, each member will be able to correct his or her vote in case of an error. The vote that is definitively registered by the system will be the last vote cast at the time of closure of the vote.

Sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohamed and Surinder Thatthi are expected to defend their seats during the World Motor Sports Council General Assembly in Paris, France on Friday.

headline: Battered and bruised, national football teams limp to end of year empty-handed
author: Victor Otieno
description: Local football enthusiasts ushered in 2021 with broken hearts.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

Kenyans heavily criticised Firat’s poor record with Moldova. Things became thick for him when Stars were humiliated 5-0 in his first assignment against Mali. It equaled Kenya’s worst-ever World Cup qualifying defeat in history — a 5-0 loss to Tanzania in 1980.
The Turk apologised unreservedly and blamed the dismal performance on “not having known his players better”.

Given a chance, Kenyans would gladly accept that the performance by national football teams in 2021 be omitted in the books of history.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • Kenyans heavily criticised Firat’s poor record with Moldova. Things became thick for him when Stars were humiliated 5-0 in his first assignment against Mali. It equaled Kenya’s worst-ever World Cup qualifying defeat in history — a 5-0 loss to Tanzania in 1980.
  • The Turk apologised unreservedly and blamed the dismal performance on “not having known his players better”.

Given a chance, Kenyans would gladly accept that the performance by national football teams in 2021 be omitted in the books of history.

headline: Kenya’s Abiud Chirchir conquers volleyball courts of France
author: Samuel Gacharira
description: He was signed in May by French Ligue B side Grand Nancy on faith and has returned the favour with interest.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

For a person who was scouted via a video, the Kenyan opposite attacker has transformed from a little-known import to the hottest name in the league, and he wants more
Eric N'Gapeth, Grand Nancy head coach, is the one who approved Chirchir’s signing in May and admits he had scanty knowledge of the player
The pair have already forged a father-son relationship off court but N’Gapeth -- who has won five Ligue A titles, four French Cups and one European Super Cup as a coach -- insists his trusted attacking outlet is far from the finished product.
His athleticism and robust attack has seen him on several occasions earn a place in Team of the Week and it is only getting better as his game improves in leaps and bounds in the European professional arena
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • For a person who was scouted via a video, the Kenyan opposite attacker has transformed from a little-known import to the hottest name in the league, and he wants more
  • Eric N'Gapeth, Grand Nancy head coach, is the one who approved Chirchir’s signing in May and admits he had scanty knowledge of the player
  • The pair have already forged a father-son relationship off court but N’Gapeth -- who has won five Ligue A titles, four French Cups and one European Super Cup as a coach -- insists his trusted attacking outlet is far from the finished product.
  • His athleticism and robust attack has seen him on several occasions earn a place in Team of the Week and it is only getting better as his game improves in leaps and bounds in the European professional arena

headline: Vihiga Queens’ illustrious seven years in top-flight football
author: Derick Luvega
description: The latest representation at the inaugural CAF Women's Champion League in Egypt was another feather in their cap.
articleBody:
By

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

On the team's performance in Egypt, where it won only one of the three group-stage matches, Ottichilo lauded the Queens for their bravery and asked the players to be "proud of themselves".

For Vihiga Queens, it has been seven years of roaring on the pitch, nationally bagging the Women Premier League title three consecutive times and still soldiering on.

By

headline: Man City rout Leeds with magnificent seven
author: AFP
description: De Bruyne delivered an imperious display including two goals.

headline: Vincent Dock aiming high after fighting off cancer
author: Victor Otieno
description: He believes he will make it. After all, he is a fighter.
articleBody:
By

Sports Reporter

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

Where there is a will there is a way for former Kenya taekwondo captain who has battled the odds with no money, no job, no hope, to once again be in tip-top shape
The resilient black belt holder was almost certain to make the Kenya taekwondo team for the 2020 Tokyo Olympic Games before Hodgkin’s lymphoma put paid to his dreams, but after months of treatment he is back on the mend, engaging in the game he so loves and is now targeting a place at next year’s World Championships in Moscow

At 33, former Kenya taekwondo captain Vincent Dock should be a man in his prime -- on top of his game and the world.

Nation. Empower Africa.

We come to you. We are always looking for ways to improve our stories. Let us know what you liked and what we can improve on.

I've got feedback!
articleBodyHtml:
By

Nation Media Group

headline: Pro-Touch clinch Dagoretti Sub-branch Junior League
author: John Ashihundu
description: The league was partly sponsored by former internationals.
articleBody:
By

Sports Writer, Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

Among the best players identified ncluded Bildad Shitiavai and Eugene Mutambo. Twelve teams took part in the Under-15 league, while the Under-13 attracted nine.

Pro-Touch FC won the Dagoretti Sub-branch Junior League which ended on Sunday at Muslim Primary School.

headline: Tusker’s dry spell persists
author: Victor Otieno
description: Tusker last scored on November 3.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

KCB continued scoring with their 2-0 romp over Ulinzi Stars at Utalii stretching their unbeaten run to eight successive matches.
Struggling Nzoia Sugar picked their first win of the season with a 3-1 victory over Sharks.

Tusker’s blunt attack continues to take a heavy toll on their campaign to defend the Football Kenya Federation Premier League (FKF-PL) title.

headline: Barcelona's Aguero poised to retire with heart condition
author: AFP
description: The 33-year-old joined Barca from Manchester City in July.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

The club said after he underwent heart tests in November that Aguero would be unavailable for the next three months while the effectiveness of treatment was evaluated.
At the time Aguero said he remained positive.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • The club said after he underwent heart tests in November that Aguero would be unavailable for the next three months while the effectiveness of treatment was evaluated.
  • At the time Aguero said he remained positive.

headline: How repeat mistakes cost Harambee Stars dearly
author: Victor Otieno
description: “It is the hope that kills you”, is a famous saying among football fans.
articleBody:
By & Michael Kirwa

What you need to know:

Plan or guess work? Coaches Mulee and Firat called up 65 players for qualifiers but only 25 were fielded even as both said talent abounded in Kenya
Kenya fail to learn from history as haphazard managerial changes and questionable team selection puts paid to elusive World Cup dream

“It is the hope that kills you”, is a famous saying among football fans.
articleBodyHtml:
By   &  Michael Kirwa

What you need to know:

  • Plan or guess work? Coaches Mulee and Firat called up 65 players for qualifiers but only 25 were fielded even as both said talent abounded in Kenya
  • Kenya fail to learn from history as haphazard managerial changes and questionable team selection puts paid to elusive World Cup dream

“It is the hope that kills you”, is a famous saying among football fans.

headline: Yemen child killed by celebratory gunfire after football win
author: AFP
description: "A four-year-old girl was killed and 36 people were injured," said the official.

headline: Man Utd v Brentford postponed because of Covid
author: AFP
description: There are growing virus issues at several Premier League clubs.
articleBody:
United's fixture in west London was the second Premier League game to fall to the virus in three days, after Tottenham Hotspur's match at Brighton on Sunday was called off.
"Manchester United can confirm that our Premier League fixture at Brentford FC, on Tuesday 14 December at 19:30, has been postponed and will be rescheduled in due course," a United statement late Monday said.
articleBodyHtml:
• United's fixture in west London was the second Premier League game to fall to the virus in three days, after Tottenham Hotspur's match at Brighton on Sunday was called off.
  • "Manchester United can confirm that our Premier League fixture at Brentford FC, on Tuesday 14 December at 19:30, has been postponed and will be rescheduled in due course," a United statement late Monday said.

headline: FKF Caretaker Committee set for country tours
author: Victor Otieno
description: The committee said the leagues had resumed smoothly.
articleBody:
By

Sports Reporter

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

Neddy Atieno, the Chairlady of the Women's Leagues sub-committee said the KWPL will resume this weekend as planned.
"There is no change in regards to the KWPL kick-off. As you know, we have Africa Women Cup of Nations qualifiers in February so we must keep the players active," she said.

By

headline: Aubameyang stripped of Arsenal captaincy
author: AFP
description: He will not be considered for Wednesday's game against West Ham.

headline: Kenyan athlete succumbs to cancer in Baringo
author: Bernard Rotich
description: Chirchir had been battling the disease since last year and had stopped training.
articleBody:
By

Sports Writer

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

Her death comes two months after the murder of 2015 World Cross Country champion Agnes Tirop in Iten Elgeyo Marakwet County and Hosea Macharinyang, who committed suicide in West Pokot.
Burial arrangements are ongoing at her parents’ home in Kipkaech in Baringo County.

The athletics fraternity has been thrown into mourning after 2019 African Games 10,000m finalist, Monica Chirchir, succumbed to Colon cancer in Kimalel, Baringo County last Saturday.
articleBodyHtml:
By

Sports Writer

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

  • Her death comes two months after the murder of 2015 World Cross Country champion Agnes Tirop in Iten Elgeyo Marakwet County and Hosea Macharinyang, who committed suicide in West Pokot.
  • Burial arrangements are ongoing at her parents’ home in Kipkaech in Baringo County. 

The athletics fraternity has been thrown into mourning after 2019 African Games 10,000m finalist, Monica Chirchir, succumbed to Colon cancer in Kimalel, Baringo County last Saturday.

headline: Thika, Vihiga Queens dominate maiden KWPL Awards
author: Lokeder Natiom
description: A total of 11 players were awarded for their performances in the 2020/21 season.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

Kefwa was formed in 2011 by 13 former footballers with the purpose of championing for better playing conditions for players on and off the pitch.
The awards come just three days before the start of the 2021/22 KWPL season that is set to kick off on December 18.

headline: Cheserek, Kiplagat win Nandi 15km Road Race titles
author: Bernard Rotich
description: Kiplagat crossed the line in 43 minutes, 43.77 seconds.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

Nandi County governor Stephen Sang said that the Eliud Kipchoge Sports Complex will have an office space which will house professional counsellors to offer social psycho-social support to athletes who may encounter problems in their career.
In the 21km cycling category, Salim Kipkemboi bagged victory after beating Evan Kimani, while Gibson Alwanda was in third place.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • Nandi County governor Stephen Sang said that the Eliud Kipchoge Sports Complex will have an office space which will house professional counsellors to offer social psycho-social support to athletes who may encounter problems in their career.
  • In the 21km cycling category, Salim Kipkemboi bagged victory after beating Evan Kimani, while Gibson Alwanda was in third place.

headline: Chepng'etich, Jepchirchir feted by Uhuru
author: AFP
description: The two athletes were feted during the Jamhuri Day celebrations.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

The two athletes were feted during the Jamhuri Day celebrations held at the Uhuru Gardens, Nairobi on Sunday for their heroics in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

Olympic 1,500 meters record holder Faith Chepng'etich and 2020 Olympic Marathon champion Peres Jepchirchir were awarded the Order of the Grand Warrior (OGW) by President Uhuru Kenyatta.

Africa backs Ethiopia protest against UN rights session

Session meant to reprimand Addis Ababa’s alleged war atrocities in Tigray region.

Africa 3 hours ago

headline: All set for Ng'elel Tarit kids race
author: Bernard Rotich
description: Eliud Kipchoge to grace race as guest.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

The race director Richard Metto, who is also a coach at the Global Sports Communication said that many athletes started their careers while in primary school thus the need to support them at young age
Metto said that world marathon record holder Eliud Kipchoge and two-time 1,500m Olympics champion Faith Chepng’etich will grace the race which has different categories
The race categories include 4-6 years (boys and girls), 7-9 years (boys and girls), 10-12 (boys and girls), 13-15 (boys and girls), 16-19 years under-20 (men and women) 25-35 years (women) and 36-45 years (women)

The third edition of Ng’elel Tarit kids race goes down on Sunday with many children expected to showcase their talent at Kipsinende Primary School in Eldoret, Uasin Gishu County.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • The race director Richard Metto, who is also a coach at the Global Sports Communication said that many athletes started their careers while in primary school thus the need to support them at young age
  • Metto said that world marathon record holder Eliud Kipchoge and two-time 1,500m Olympics champion Faith Chepng’etich will grace the race which has different categories
  • The race categories include 4-6 years (boys and girls), 7-9 years (boys and girls), 10-12 (boys and girls), 13-15 (boys and girls), 16-19 years under-20 (men and women) 25-35 years (women) and 36-45 years (women)

The third edition of Ng’elel Tarit kids race goes down on Sunday with many children expected to showcase their talent at Kipsinende Primary School in Eldoret, Uasin Gishu County.

headline: Kamau, Muriuki win inaugural Tetu road race
author: Joseph Kanyi
description: Over 100 athletes from Nyandurua, Nakuru and Nyeri participated in the event.
articleBody:
By

Photojournalist

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

In the men’s category, Kamau battled a strong field of elite runners from Nyahururu clubs to emerge victorious posting 31 minutes, 10.84 seconds
It was a different story in the women's category where the intense heat and hilly course forced majority to either drop out or literally walk a good part of the race
Muriuki urged organisers to sustain the race terming it as a good event for altitude test for local and international runners

International roadrunners Michael Kamau and Shelmith Muriuki braved a hot morning to win the inaugural Tetu Jamhuri 10km Road Race at Wamagana in Nyeri County on Saturday.
articleBodyHtml:
By

Photojournalist

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

  • In the men’s category, Kamau battled a strong field of elite runners from Nyahururu clubs to emerge victorious posting 31 minutes, 10.84 seconds
  • It was a different story in the women's category where the intense heat and hilly course forced majority to either drop out or literally walk a good part of the race
  • Muriuki urged organisers to sustain the race terming it as a good event for altitude test for local and international runners

International roadrunners Michael Kamau and Shelmith Muriuki braved a hot morning to win the inaugural Tetu Jamhuri 10km Road Race at Wamagana in Nyeri County on Saturday.

headline: Ruthless students force Homeboyz to drink Blak Blad
author: Geoffrey Anene
description: KCB humiliate Nakuru 62-5 at the Den.
articleBody:
By

What you need to know:

Kenya Sevens speedster Archadius Khwesa's hat-trick lifts Blak Blad past Homeboyz
In the second of the two fixtures held at KCB’s den, the bankers were too strong for Nakuru, registering the biggest winning margin so far this season, 62-5
At the RFUEA Grounds, Kenya Harlequin were made to sweat in a nail-biting 21-20 win against visitors Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology (MMUST)

Kenyatta University’s Blak Blad picked their first points of the 2021/22 Kenya Cup season by humiliating limping Homeboyz 28-0 as bitter rivals Kabras Sugar and defending champions KCB maintained their perfect start on Saturday.
articleBodyHtml:
By

What you need to know:

  • Kenya Sevens speedster Archadius Khwesa's hat-trick lifts Blak Blad past Homeboyz 
  • In the second of the two fixtures held at KCB’s den, the bankers were too strong for Nakuru, registering the biggest winning margin so far this season, 62-5
  • At the RFUEA Grounds, Kenya Harlequin were made to sweat in a nail-biting 21-20 win against visitors Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology (MMUST)

Kenyatta University’s Blak Blad picked their first points of the 2021/22 Kenya Cup season by humiliating limping Homeboyz 28-0 as bitter rivals Kabras Sugar and defending champions KCB maintained their perfect start on Saturday.

headline: Ex-Kenya Simbas skipper Brian Nyikuli retires
author: Ayumba Ayodi
description: He won seven Kenya Cup titles with Impala Saracens, Quins and KCB Rugby.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

Nyikuli led Kenya Simbas in the Africa Cup (Rugby Africa Gold Cup) finals from 2014 to 2017.
He also gave credit to his former coaches Bill Githinji, Edward Kinyany, Mitch Ocholla, Curtis Olago, Gordon Anampiu, Edward Rombo, the late Benjamin Ayimba, Michael Otieno, and Jerome Paarwater for shaping his rugby career.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • Nyikuli led Kenya Simbas in the Africa Cup (Rugby Africa Gold Cup) finals from 2014 to 2017.
  • He also gave credit to his former coaches Bill Githinji, Edward Kinyany, Mitch Ocholla, Curtis Olago, Gordon Anampiu, Edward Rombo, the late Benjamin Ayimba, Michael Otieno, and Jerome Paarwater for shaping his rugby career.

headline: Fifa appoints committees to supervise Guinea, Chad FAs
author: AFP
description: Chad were readmitted to international football last month.
articleBody:
By

What you need to know:

Chad were readmitted to international football last month after Fifa lifted a suspension imposed in April for government interference.
The national team was disqualified from the final two rounds of qualifying matches for January's Africa Cup of Nations after the government dissolved the FTFA.

Lausanne, Switzerland
articleBodyHtml:
By

What you need to know:

  • Chad were readmitted to international football last month after Fifa lifted a suspension imposed in April for government interference.
  • The national team was disqualified from the final two rounds of qualifying matches for January's Africa Cup of Nations after the government dissolved the FTFA.

Lausanne, Switzerland

headline: Nigeria sacks Rohr as national coach
author: AFP
description: The NFF said former coach Augustine Eguavoen would take charge of the Super Eagles.

headline: Disputed Ayew penalty takes Ghana to World Cup play-offs, DR Congo through
author: AFP
description: Ghana and DR Congo join Egypt, Mali, Morocco and Senegal in the play-offs.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

Mali finished seven points ahead of second-place Uganda in Group E after winning the top-of-the-table clash 1-0 in the Moroccan coastal city of Agadir through a Kalifa Coulibaly goal.
The Malian Eagles, seeking a maiden World Cup appearance, were the only country among the 40 in the group stage not to concede,
On Monday, Kenya host Rwanda in the same section with both sides chasing a first victory and wanting to avoid the embarrassment of finishing last.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • Mali finished seven points ahead of second-place Uganda in Group E after winning the top-of-the-table clash 1-0 in the Moroccan coastal city of Agadir through a Kalifa Coulibaly goal.
  • The Malian Eagles, seeking a maiden World Cup appearance, were the only country among the 40 in the group stage not to concede,
  • On Monday, Kenya host Rwanda in the same section with both sides chasing a first victory and wanting to avoid the embarrassment of finishing last.

headline: Why South Africa want World Cup qualifier replayed
author: AFP
description: TV replays showed Ghana defender Daniel Amartey apparently diving during the Group G decider.
articleBody:
By

What you need to know:

Ghana and South Africa finished level on points and goal difference and the Black Stars won the section because they scored seven goals, one more than Bafana Bafana (The Boys), over six matches.
"Justice needs to be served and the match replayed," South African Football Association chief executive Tebogo Mothlante told reporters as he slammed the refereeing of Senegalese Maguette Ndiaye.
articleBodyHtml:
By

What you need to know:

  • Ghana and South Africa finished level on points and goal difference and the Black Stars won the section because they scored seven goals, one more than Bafana Bafana (The Boys), over six matches.
  • "Justice needs to be served and the match replayed," South African Football Association chief executive Tebogo Mothlante told reporters as he slammed the refereeing of Senegalese Maguette Ndiaye.

headline: Ethiopian Gidey Letesnbet breaks half marathon world record
author: Bernard Rotich
description: Kenya's Ruth Chepng’etich held the previous record.
articleBody:
What you need to know:

The battle was between the two Kenyan athletes who exchanged leads in the homestretch before Kipchumba accelerated as Kipruto tried to hang on but he had nothing left in the last 100m/
Kipruto, who finished third last year, was among four athletes to run under 58 minutes with his compatriot Kibiwott Kandie breaking the world recorda after clocking 57:32.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • The battle was between the two Kenyan athletes who exchanged leads in the homestretch before Kipchumba accelerated as Kipruto tried to hang on but he had nothing left in the last 100m/
  • Kipruto, who finished third last year, was among four athletes to run under 58 minutes with his compatriot Kibiwott Kandie breaking the world recorda after clocking 57:32.

headline: Salah has two objectives as African World Cup qualifying intensifies
author: AFP
description: Algeria and Burkina Faso are heading for a final round showdown.
articleBody:
By

What you need to know:

Qualifying for the 2022 tournament in Qatar intensifies on the continent with the last two group rounds, with victory in Luanda moving Egypt into the next stage as Group F winners.
The two-time African Footballer of the Year wants to get back on the goal trail in Angola having failed to find the net in his last three appearances for the Merseysiders.
articleBodyHtml:
By

What you need to know:

  • Qualifying for the 2022 tournament in Qatar intensifies on the continent with the last two group rounds, with victory in Luanda moving Egypt into the next stage as Group F winners.  
  • The two-time African Footballer of the Year wants to get back on the goal trail in Angola having failed to find the net in his last three appearances for the Merseysiders.

headline: Clubs ring the changes for Kenya Cup fixtures
author: Ayumba Ayodi
description:
Unbeaten Kabras Sugar, Strathmore Leos and Menengai Oilers have made changes to their squads ahead of the third round of Kenya Cup matches Saturday.
Kabras Sugar have made 10 changes to the side...
articleBody:
By

Sports Writer

Nation Media Group

What you need to know:

Kabras Sugar have made 10 changes to the side that meets limping Mwamba at the Kakamega showground, with Steve Sikuta, brother to Kenya international Dan, getting to start against his former club.
Sikuta came in as a sub on his debut for Kabras Sugar the previous weekend against Nakuru, replacing injured Geoffrey Messo.
articleBodyHtml:
By

Sports Writer

Nation Media Group

  • Sikuta came in as a sub on his debut for Kabras Sugar the previous weekend against Nakuru, replacing injured Geoffrey Messo.

headline: Samuel Eto'o elected Fecafoot president
author: AFP
description: Eto'o said Njoya, who he supported in 2018, had "failed miserably".
articleBody:
By

What you need to know:

The former Barcelona and Inter Milan star gained 43 votes to beat acting president Seidou Mbombo Njoya, who collected 31
The vote was held after the Court of Arbitration for Sport in January annulled Njoya's victory in a 2018 election
Cameroon will host the African Cup of Nations in January, a tournament delayed a year by the Covid-19 pandemic

Yaoundé, Cameroon
articleBodyHtml:
By

What you need to know:

  • The former Barcelona and Inter Milan star gained 43 votes to beat acting president Seidou Mbombo Njoya, who collected 31

  • Cameroon will host the African Cup of Nations in January, a tournament delayed a year by the Covid-19 pandemic

headline: Nigeria move closer to topping World Cup group
author: AFP
description: The Super Eagles host Cape Verde in a top-of-the-table Group C clash on Tuesday.
articleBody:
By

What you need to know:

Tunisia host Zambia, who are three points behind the leaders, and Equatorial Guinea visit Mauritania on Tuesday in the final round.
Egypt, Mali, Morocco and Senegal have secured play-off places and Ghana or South Africa and the Democratic Republic of Congo or Benin will join them on Sunday.
articleBodyHtml:
By

What you need to know:

  • Tunisia host Zambia, who are three points behind the leaders, and Equatorial Guinea visit Mauritania on Tuesday in the final round.
  • Egypt, Mali, Morocco and Senegal have secured play-off places and Ghana or South Africa and the Democratic Republic of Congo or Benin will join them on Sunday.

headline: Caf backs biennial World Cup
author: AFP
description: The Africa Cup of Nations is also held after two years.
articleBody:
By

What you need to know:

Caf is the first confederation to officially and publicly approve the controversial plan to hold a World Cup every two years, at the same pace as its Africa Cup of Nations tournament
The confederation, at its extraordinary general assembly in Cairo, also voted in favour of establishing a Super League for African clubs
Opposition has been so widespread from leagues, players and supporters groups that the chances of a biennial World Cup actually happening appear remote
articleBodyHtml:
By

What you need to know:

  • Caf is the first confederation to officially and publicly approve the controversial plan to hold a World Cup every two years, at the same pace as its Africa Cup of Nations tournament
  • The confederation, at its extraordinary general assembly in Cairo, also voted in favour of establishing a Super League for African clubs
  • Opposition has been so widespread from leagues, players and supporters groups that the chances of a biennial World Cup actually happening appear remote

headline: Maiden title for Verstappen, but what an acrimonious end to a stellar season!
author: Alex Mwangi
description: Mercedes secured a record eighth consecutive Constructors’ title.
articleBody: 2021 FIA Formula One World Champion Red Bull's Dutch driver Max Verstappen celebrates on the podium of the Yas Marina Circuit after the Abu Dhabi Formula One Grand Prix on December 12, 2021. Max Verstappen became the first Dutchman ever to win the Formula One world championship title when he won a dramatic season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix at the Yas Marina circuit on December 12, 2021. The Red Bull driver won his 10th race of the season to finish ahead of seven-time champion Lewis Hamilton.
articleBodyHtml: 2021 FIA Formula One World Champion Red Bull's Dutch driver Max Verstappen celebrates on the podium of the Yas Marina Circuit after the Abu Dhabi Formula One Grand Prix on December 12, 2021. Max Verstappen became the first Dutchman ever to win the Formula One world championship title when he won a dramatic season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix at the Yas Marina circuit on December 12, 2021. The Red Bull driver won his 10th race of the season to finish ahead of seven-time champion Lewis Hamilton.
